Scheduling update: We have received feedback from some families that having multiple lunch times across grade levels at the elementary school can be difficult for families with more than one child.

When schools created master schedules, we considered what spaces & schedules would look like when we return in person. Since state guidelines require us to have no more than 50 people in one space, lunch/recess periods will look different than what we have traditionally experienced. Lunch schedules, students' specials (music, art, PE) schedules, when some staff are available to serve students with special needs, and teacher plan time schedules, are all connected. Therefore, the lunch hour largely was not shared across grade levels.

Our elementary schools are taking a look at their schedules now to try and align lunch hours where possible for this time while we remain in remote learning. Thank you for your flexibility and understanding as we consider options to address this situation.

The Board of Education approved the 2020-2021 school calendar at its January meeting. The first day of school for students in grades 1-8 is Wednesday, August 19. The first day of school for kindergarten and pre-k students is Thursday, August 20.

This calendar reflects an alignment with winter and spring breaks with High School District 214. The first day of school is more in line with previous District 21 calendars; the later-than-usual start of school for the 2019-2020 year was as a result of the scope of construction that was completed during summer 2019.

Also, in an effort to more closely align parent-teacher conferences to the end of the first trimester, be consistent in conference scheduling district wide, and respond to survey feedback, parent-teacher conferences will be held Monday, November 23, and Tuesday, November 24. Students will not be in attendance at all during the week of Thanksgiving, but staff will report on Monday and Tuesday. Daytime and evening conference times will be available.
